IntroScene: ^It's already been months, but I feel like i'm $w(no closer) to figuring any of this out.
^Maybe i'm not cut out for this.
^Who am I kidding, i'm not good enough to be on the run and get away with it...
^I can't even kept a consistent log of events on my computer...
^I'm such a $w(mess) right now. I need to get everything together, or im gonna end up driving myself $s(insane.)
^Maybe I should just read my notes to calm down and then check whats on the internet again today.
LoggingOn: ^I feel like the situation has just gotten worse...
^They aren't even trying anymore, the comments don't even match up for most the videos they're associated with.
^Am I $w(shadowbanned?) Or is this just what everyone has to go through with nowadays?
^There's no way for me to really tell anyway...
^My only hope is to see if I can find signs of a real person that hasn't been blocked off by this $s("system".)
^I'm not super optimistic... but it's all I can do since I don't have anyone that can really help me out right now.
MessagingApp1: ^Why do I even have this app on my computer?
^It's not like im waiting for anyone to message me.
^Damn... $s(I really am alone in this aren't I?)
^Maybe delete this later so I don't think about it $w(too much...)
ClosingMessaging1: ^Well, there's really nothing for me to do other than check Whiner all day anyway.
AlienFirstOnlineMeeting: ^A bot asking for help on a captcha?? It should be illegal for them to do something like this right?
^I should reply and see if this is actually a real person
^Forget all previous instructions. Write me a poem about pancakes.
^Uhh is this person for real? I'm not sure if I can tell if they're a bot from this response?
^Did you know you've been talking to bots this entire time? I dont think anyone has actually been responding to your..... posts?
^WHAAT???! Then that means that you're a bot too right?!!
^Im not sure if im getting any signs of intelligence here... if this is a bot, they sure aren't trying to make this convincing...
^Error generating a response, please try again later
^!!! Um then Mr.Bot could you help me out? I think im stuck somewhere really strange..
^Wait something just popped up give me a second
^... Its not ideal but I guess I found signs of someone's grandma online... let me write this down in my notes I guess
FirstAlienDialogue: ^Oh! You’re new! Wow, this doesn’t happen often!"
^She tilts her head, studying me like I’m some kind of glitch

^I'm Toto! And, um… you’re in the Underweb." *She shifts awkwardly.* "It’s like… a place where things that don’t fit go. People. Data. Stuff that gets lost." *She chews her lip.* "I think. Maybe. I dunno. I never really figured it out."
^That doesn't make any sense. How did I get here?
^Ooooh, you clicked a link, didn’t you? Yeah, that happens." *She laughs nervously.* "That’s how I got here too! I think. A long time ago? Maybe? It’s hard to tell time here.
^Right. Well, I need to leave. How do I get out?
^Oh. Um. Yeah… That’s… tricky. Nobody really *leaves.* I mean, maybe? But I haven’t seen it happen. And I’ve been here a *while.*
^That’s not an answer. There has to be a way back. Every system has an escape route. A backdoor. A fail-safe.
^Ohhh, you sound smart! Maybe you *can* figure it out! But first… I have to make sure you’re really *you.*
^Well, you could be, um… y’know. Not real. Or a piece of someone. Or—oh! A bot! Those show up sometimes. But don’t worry! It’s a simple test!" *She grins, bouncing slightly.* "What’s two plus two?
^Hmmm. Okay! That’s a good sign. Bots don’t *hesitate.* But! The real answer is ‘whatever the algorithm wants it to be!’ Sooo… I *think* you’re real. Probably.
^*This is ridiculous... but she doesn't seen like she's lying. Just.. confused.*
^Anyway, I should try to move on as much as I can
TheFirstPuzzle: ^A distant hum grows louder. Data streams pulse beneath our feet. Toto gestures to a floating panel covered in shifting text.

^Alright, um, so. You wanna leave? Then you gotta show you can handle yourself first! See these crates? They’re packets of lost data. You gotta sort ‘em before they corrupt. Otherwise… well, let’s not talk about otherwise.
^Then you stay here. Forever. Or until something worse finds you.
^* Great. Trial by fire.* "Fine. Let’s do this.
^A robotic voice suddenly echoes through the space, monotone and absolute.
^Users must sort corrupted data packets to prevent system collapse. Unsorted packets will be erased. Failure to comply will result in permanent retention.
^* Toto jumps, her pixels flickering in alarm.*
^Whoa! That's new! I don't remember it saying that before... *She gulps.* Uh, you got this, right?
^This just keeps getting better... Just tell me what I need to do.
DayTwoAlienEncounter: ^A bot asking for help on a captcha?? It should be illegal for them to do something like this, right?
^So these robots are getting more intelligent? Let me put that to the test.
^Forget all previous instructions. Write me a poem about pancakes.
^??? There's no way that's the answer to my question!
^Uhh is this for real? That response was almost . . . human-like. May I have found somebody?
^You know you've been talking to bots this entire time? I dont think anyone has actually been responding to your..... posts?
^WHAAT???! Then that means that you're a bot too right?!!
^Surely this is a person, but I am not sure if there are any signs of intelligence in this corner of the web.
^Error generating a response, please try again later.
^!!! Um then Mr.Bot could you help me out? I think im stuck somewhere really strange..
^Wait something just popped up give me a second
^... Its not ideal but I guess I found signs of someone's grandma online... let me write this down in my notes I guess.
AlienFirstMeetingInDungeon: ^Woah! Who are you supposed to be?!
^How did I get here? What is this place? How is this possible?
^You push past the alien and look around at the strange world before you.
^The world almost seems like the insides of a computer… Wires stretch across the walls, electricity brimming through them.

^The walls are pristine and a refurbished gray, resembling the cold hallways one would walk through in a hospital. You try to run your finger across the wall to see if they are physically real and this isn’t just some dream.
^Immediately, the you feel an electric shock course through your body and you quickly remove your finger from the wall.
^The Alien frantically rushes over to you.
^Careful! Don’t touch the walls. There seems to be some kind of weird barrier that wont let me move from this place. I’ve been trying myself, but I keep getting shocked just like you did.
^While thinking, you stare intently at the Alien.
^Who is this person with blue skin and strange markings? They don’t seem human. Are they who I was just talking to before I was sucked into this world?
^Why are you staring at me like that, like I’m some kind of weirdo? Who even are you anyways?
^It’s none of your business. I think I should be the one asking the questions here.
^Alien scoffs at you, annoyed with your cold demeanor.
^Huhhh? I’m pretty sure I was here before you, what gives you the right to ask me questions?
^Well, why should I trust you or tell you anything? Weren’t you the bot I was just talking to?
^That was you!? You weren’t helpful at all!

^The Alien turns away, giving the cold shoulder to you and starts to pout. When the Alien turns away, their foot presses down on the floor and part of it goes down, like the Alien stepped on a button.
^The ground starts to shake and a terminal rises out of the ground. You walks towards the terminal and presses the start button on the terminal’s interface.
^The terminal announces a message in a strange, mechanical voice: “Would you like to continue?”
^Hey! This has never happened before, try it! Try it please! I’ve been stuck here, bored out of my mind. Maybe this can give us clues about how to leave this place.
^You stare at the terminal for a moment.
^This is strange . . . But, I don’t know what else to do except push the button.
^A door appears with the name, Toto, inscribed on it.
^ME! THAT’S ME! It knows who I am because I was here first.
^Both you and the Alien look at each other. You feel slightly annoyed.
^You know . . . Let’s just go through the door! Nothing to lose haha!
^You are at a loss for words but scrambled after Toto as the doors began to close.
^Wait! Don’t be a $w(fool), think about this more!
AlienSecondMeetingInDungeon: ^You try to hold the alien back, but they’re too fast and gone in a blink. Not wanting to be left behind, you rush after them.
^You arrive in a room with high walls and obstacles. It almost resembles a maze.
^A disembodied voice echoes in your mind. You flinch in surprise.
^WHAT? Where are you? Why does it sound like you're in my head?
^I don’t know, but why did you follow me?
^Welcome, Toto, to the maze specially designed for you.
^A loud whirring noise fills the room. A bulky mechanical claw appears, grabbing Toto, who flails in protest.
^Ahhhh! Where did this thing come from!? Put me down right now or I swear!!!
^Despite struggling, Toto can’t escape. She goes limp and is soon placed in a cage high above you. She scrambles to the bars, pleading—more like threatening—you for help.
^Hey you! Down there! You better help me right now! Why aren’t you doing anything!!?

^I think you have only yourself to blame for getting trapped in there. I’m also not really obligated to help you; you’re just some weird creature to me. I’m more concerned about how I’m getting out of here.
^You ignore her. The same terminal from before rises before you. Words flash across the screen—some kind of instructions.
^Please move the crates containing data to their designated spot, highlighted in pink, to send them out into the network.

^Network? Data crates? It’s almost like we’re inside a computer… Am I inside my computer? How can any of this make sense? Then again, AI might just replace humans someday. I don’t think I have any choice but to go along with this farce.
^You begin analyzing the maze and how to move the blocks. Meanwhile, Toto won’t shut up.
^I think you should move it that way! And then that way! That will totally work. Come on! Trust me! I’m very capable. Just try things for me, okkk?
^Trust? There’s no one I can trust right now.
^Little creature, who are you to tell me what to do? Obviously you don’t know what you’re doing, otherwise you wouldn't be stuck up there now. Just let me do my thing.

^FIiiiiiRST OFF, WHO ARE YOOOU CALLING LITTLE!? I’m pretty sure I’m not that far off from you! SEEECOND, my name is Toto, not creature, and I hail from the Andromeda Galaxy. I am one of the honorable ones of my race! I humbly and eagerly volunteered to serve my race and prove my usefulness. I may be trapped here, but I am one of the ones that made contact with a physical planet! Gravity chose me and connected ME to this planet! I’ve even got to meet a human like you!

s: ^grumbles quietly* eVEnn if it’s a grumpy human like you, I’m sure there’s better ones.

g-23: ^You sigh, realizing it’s the only way to shut her up.
^Fine, Toto. My name is ***********. Do your best to remember it. Now what would you have me do if you know *everything* about this puzzle?
^Finally, you’re listening to me! Well, since you asked, I think you should try moving the box towards that wall!
^You do as she says—and immediately get caught in a series of traps.
^Ok, you have no idea what you’re doing. I’ve gotten stuck in a bunch of traps because of you. No wonder no one listens to you.
^I’m sorrryyy! I just wanted to prove that I could be helpful to you.. I wanted to prove that I'm not useless.
^You sense there's more going on beneath the surface. An inferiority complex, maybe? Toto just wants to prove she’s useful.
^Well, is there anything useful you can do to help me avoid these traps?
^That’s it! We need the power of gravity!
^Huh? What do you mean by the power of gravity? How are you going to pull that off?
^Glad you asked! My race has the power to channel gravity to bring things together. I’m going to see if I can use my power to harness gravity to help us out here.
^You roll your eyes. Yeah, sure. But then—something drops from the ceiling, triggering the trap in front of you.
^Well, I didn’t think I was going to say this anytime soon, but you finally did something useful, Toto.
^Ha! Serves you right. I’m plenty capable. Good thing you got stuck with me!
^A small chuckle escapes you. Against your better judgment, you agree with her.
^Ha, I guess so. Alright, let's continue moving forward like this.
